DataElement.preferredName: FACIT-TS-G Version 1 TS1 Rate Treatment Effectiveness So Far Compared to Expected Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated rating of the effectiveness of their treatment so far as compared to what they expected, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACIT-TS-G Treatment Effectiveness So Far Compared to Expected Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate general satisfaction with treatment._A question about how an individual would rate the effectiveness of their treatment so far compared to what they expected._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: FACIT Quality Comparison Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with values ranging from 0 (A lot worse) to 4 (A lot better) used in FACIT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is a lot better.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is a lot better.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is a little better.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is a little better.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In an unchanged or similar condition.

Concepts.definition: The status is unaltered or similar to the previous state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is a little worse.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is a little worse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is a lot worse.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is a lot worse.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Compared to what you expected
ReferenceDocuments.description: Compared to what you expected, how do you rate the effectiveness of the treatment so far?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Materials Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
